commits.message: add option to make examples optional

Remove CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE default

was Develop, which doesn't match either of the later checks

move CMAKE_OSX_ARCHITECTURES before project

this variable should be set *before* project is called.
Doing this fixes the undefined library symbols issue

Revert "remove install commands"

This reverts commit 3616fba655ae57776ad00059b2421c55760a97e0.
add ifdefs to all necessary examples
add description and homepage to vcpkg
add warnings if can't find libsndfile/libsoundio

fix missing symbols

need to set macOS architectures BEFORE project()
add if def guard to audio in example
add dependencies to signal flow vcpkg.json
add dependencies to signal flow vcpkg.json

payload.description: vcpkg registry to consume ideoforms/signalflow
vcpkg registry to consume ideoforms/signalflow

commits.message: make python into a cmake option
print message if no features enabled

Revert "enable building on intel mac"

This reverts commit 3ec40fc30ada41364298e70267366d2aa6dbff43.

This commit has an error, it uses ${ARCHS_STANDARD} instead of the correct
value of $(ARCHS_STANDARD). The reason it still worked was ${ARCHS_STANDARD}
is a CMake variable, and is set to "" by default.

The parentheses version will work correctly if using Xcode or Makefiles as your
build system, but fails with ninja (default build system for CLion).
build works, split up this commit
use vcpkg to manage all dependencies

issue.title: Revert "enable building on intel mac"
issue.body:
This reverts commit 3ec40fc30ada41364298e70267366d2aa6dbff43.

This commit has an error, it uses `${ARCHS_STANDARD}` instead of the correct
value of `$(ARCHS_STANDARD)`. The reason it still worked was `${ARCHS_STANDARD}`
is a CMake variable, and is set to `""` by default.

The parentheses version will work correctly if using Xcode or Makefiles as your
build system, but fails with ninja (default build system for CLion).

comment.body:
The real issue is not having arm64 versions of dependencies. Looks like homebrew only installs the architecture you need. Going to investigate if vcpkg solves this.

```

payload.description: A sound synthesis framework for Python, designed for clear and concise expression of complex musical ideas

pull_request.title: Revert "enable building on intel mac"
pull_request.body:
This reverts commit 3ec40fc30ada41364298e70267366d2aa6dbff43.

This commit has an error, it uses ${ARCHS_STANDARD} instead of the correct
value of $(ARCHS_STANDARD). The reason it still worked was ${ARCHS_STANDARD}
is a CMake variable, and is set to "" by default.

The parentheses version will work correctly if using Xcode or Makefiles as your
build system, but fails with ninja (default build system for CLion).

repo.name: signalflow
repo.description: A sound synthesis framework for Python, designed for clear and concise expression of complex musical ideas

repo.name: signalflow
repo.description: A sound synthesis framework for Python, designed for clear and concise expression of complex musical ideas

issue.title: Enable building on intel mac
issue.body:
Specifying arm64 causes builds to fail on intel macs. With `ARCHS_STANDARD` CMake will make a Universal build by
default, but will work on intel macs.

comment.body:
OK it looks like I jumped the gun on this and the real blocker to building was something else.

This PR has an error, it uses `${ARCHS_STANDARD}` instead of the correct value of `$(ARCHS_STANDARD)`. The reason it still worked was `${ARCHS_STANDARD}` is a CMake variable, and is set to `""` by default. 

The parentheses version will work correctly if using Xcode or Makefiles as your build system, but fails with ninja (default build system for CLion).

I suggest reverting this back to `"arm64;x86_64"`, which will build on an intel machine.

Apologies for the confusion!

pull_request.title: Use vcpkg for dependency management
pull_request.body:
Use [vcpkg](https://vcpkg.io/en/index.html) to install and manage dependencies. Vamp is an feature (optional) dependency, which can be enabled in CMakeLists.txt

I have tested this on mac to build C++ and python, needs testing on windows and linux. I think this may remove the special windows build instructions.

pull_request.body:
This reverts commit 3ec40fc30ada41364298e70267366d2aa6dbff43.

This commit has an error, it uses ${ARCHS_STANDARD} instead of the correct
value of $(ARCHS_STANDARD). The reason it still worked was ${ARCHS_STANDARD}
is a CMake variable, and is set to "" by default.

The parentheses version will work correctly if using Xcode or Makefiles as your
build system, but fails with ninja (default build system for CLion).

issue.title: Enable building on intel mac
issue.body:
Specifying arm64 causes builds to fail on intel macs. With `ARCHS_STANDARD` CMake will make a Universal build by
default, but will work on intel macs.

comment.body:
OK it looks like I jumped the gun on this and the real blocker to building was something else.

This PR has an error, it uses `${ARCHS_STANDARD}` instead of the correct value of `$(ARCHS_STANDARD)`. The reason it still worked was `${ARCHS_STANDARD}` is a CMake variable, and is set to `""` by default. 

The parentheses version will work correctly if using Xcode or Makefiles as your build system, but fails with ninja (default build system for CLion).

I suggest reverting this back to `"arm64;x86_64"`, which will build on an intel machine.

Apologies for the confusion!

I have tested this on mac to build C++ and python, needs testing on windows and linux. I think this may remove the special windows build instructions.

payload.description: A sound synthesis framework for Python, designed for clear and concise expression of complex musical ideas

pull_request.title: Revert "enable building on intel mac"
pull_request.body:
This reverts commit 3ec40fc30ada41364298e70267366d2aa6dbff43.

This commit has an error, it uses ${ARCHS_STANDARD} instead of the correct
value of $(ARCHS_STANDARD). The reason it still worked was ${ARCHS_STANDARD}
is a CMake variable, and is set to "" by default.

The parentheses version will work correctly if using Xcode or Makefiles as your
build system, but fails with ninja (default build system for CLion).

repo.name: signalflow
repo.description: A sound synthesis framework for Python, designed for clear and concise expression of complex musical ideas

repo.name: signalflow
repo.description: A sound synthesis framework for Python, designed for clear and concise expression of complex musical ideas

issue.title: Enable building on intel mac
issue.body:
Specifying arm64 causes builds to fail on intel macs. With `ARCHS_STANDARD` CMake will make a Universal build by
default, but will work on intel macs.

comment.body:
OK it looks like I jumped the gun on this and the real blocker to building was something else.

This PR has an error, it uses `${ARCHS_STANDARD}` instead of the correct value of `$(ARCHS_STANDARD)`. The reason it still worked was `${ARCHS_STANDARD}` is a CMake variable, and is set to `""` by default. 

The parentheses version will work correctly if using Xcode or Makefiles as your build system, but fails with ninja (default build system for CLion).

I suggest reverting this back to `"arm64;x86_64"`, which will build on an intel machine.

Apologies for the confusion!

pull_request.title: Use vcpkg for dependency management
pull_request.body:
Use [vcpkg](https://vcpkg.io/en/index.html) to install and manage dependencies. Vamp is an feature (optional) dependency, which can be enabled in CMakeLists.txt

I have tested this on mac to build C++ and python, needs testing on windows and linux. I think this may remove the special windows build instructions.
